column4: how can I find all my music in all my hard drives,and move it to one simple place where I can load it with amarok?
I haven't been able to make a collection yet, mysql is set up and all but nothing happens
you could try something like "find / -iname "*.mp3" | xargs -I % move "%" /home/xenon/music/
BUT
that would jumble all the files in one dir
and could create problems if there are more than one file with the same name
wait
i'd suggest you use something like picard
then you could have all your music nice and sorted by artist/album
you could probably do something a bit more refined
are you using bash ?
find / -iname *.mp3" | xargs -I % dirname "%" | sort | uniq | xargs % mv "%" /home/xenon/music
would move the directories holding the files into your music dir
not a perfect solution
but slightly prettier
might want to add a -i to the "mv" command
find / -iname *.mp3" | xargs -I % dirname "%" | sort | uniq | xargs % echo mv "%" /home/xenon/music
find / -iname *.mp3" | xargs -I % dirname "%" | sort | uniq | xargs -I % echo mv "%" /home/xenon/music
find / -iname "*.mp3" -print0 | xargs -0 -I % dirname "%" | sort | uniq | xargs -I % echo mv "%" /home/xenon/music
find / -iname "*.mp3" -print0 | xargs -0 -I % dirname "%" | sort | uniq | xargs -I % echo mv \"%\" /home/xenon/music
will handle spaces in filenames as well
